page_analysis.text_content:
Light well & stairwell standards
& site planning

Fig 39 Examples of site plan w/light wells & stairwells

Interior lot example

Rear yard

• Such features may not be located on the side of the struc-
ture that faces the front yard.

• Maximum width (interior dimension) is 3'.

• The combined length (interior dimensions of the opening
excluding encasing structure) of all the excavated features
may not exceed 30% of basement perimeter.

• Allowable encroachment into required side yard is 3' max
(however feature must be a minimum of 3' from side lot
line).

• Allowable encroachment into required rear yard is 4'.

• The combined length (interior dimensions of the opening
excluding encasing structure) of all the excavated features
or portions of features that encroach into the required
yards, on all sides of the structure, may not exceed 15'.

• Excavated features shall not be harmful to neighboring
trees.

• Public Works Department must approve drainage system.

Lightwells & stairwells
• a + b (encroaching features) may not exceed 15'
• a + b + c + d (all features) may not exceed 30% of
the perimeter of the basement

Note: measurments are based on interior dimension of
opening and exclude encasing structure.

42

visual_elements.description: A site plan illustrating an 'Interior lot example' with a 'Rear yard' and 'Front yard'. It shows a 'Buildable area' (light grey dashed outline) containing a 'Main dwelling' (dark grey solid shape). Two lightwells/stairwells are depicted: one (black solid shape) encroaching into the interior-side yard, labeled with 'c' for its length and '3' max. width' for its width, and another (white solid shape) also in the interior-side yard, labeled with 'd' for its length. The diagram includes dimensions for setbacks and encroachments: '3' min. from lot line (Typ.)' and '3' max. into side yard (Typ.)'. The interior-side yard is labeled on both sides of the main dwelling. The diagram also shows a lightwell/stairwell (black solid shape) on the other interior-side yard, labeled with 'b' for its length, and another (white solid shape) on the rear of the dwelling, labeled with 'a' for its length. A '3' max width' label is associated with the lightwell/stairwell on the rear of the dwelling.
visual_elements.location: Right side, spanning top to bottom

visual_elements.description:
A legend for the site plan diagram, defining various line types and shaded areas:
- Solid black line: Curb
- Dashed black line: Lot line
- Grey checkered pattern: Sidewalk
- Dashed black line with small dashes: Required setbacks
- Light grey shaded area with dashed outline: Buildable area
- Dark grey shaded area: Dwelling
- Black shaded area: Lightwells & stairwells
- White shaded area: Lightwells, & stairwells that encroach into the required yards
visual_elements.location: Bottom right of the page, below the diagram
